abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column says special savings accounts for disabled people are expected to start in most states in 2016.
lead_paragraph: The plans, known as 529A or Able accounts, are being created in most states and could grow to $100,000 without jeopardizing federal benefits.

headline.main: Tax-Free Savings Accounts for Disabled Are Expected in 2016
headline.print_headline: Tax-Free Savings Accounts for Disabled Are Expected in 2016

snippet: The plans, known as 529A or Able accounts, are being created in most states and could grow to $100,000 without jeopardizing federal benefits.
